intro: Zanthoxylum hidalgense, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its spiny branches, opposite leaves, and small yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a berry that turns red when mature and contains several seeds. Zanthoxylum hidalgense is valued for its ornamental features and has traditional uses in local medicine.
